Drug Free Workplace :

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Union :

This is a union-represented position.

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

Printed Circuit Board Design Engineer (PCB Engineer)

PCB Design Engineer

Location: San Antonio, Texas, United States

Employment Type: Full Time | Direct Hire | On Site

Overview

Reliance One, Inc. is hiring for one of our clients for a PCB Design Engineer to develop printed circuit boards for advanced products including engine controllers, fuel system devices, lithium-ion battery management systems (BMS) and chargers, and IoT telematics systems. This role requires precision, collaboration, and expertise with Altium design software.

Key Responsibilities
• Design printed circuit boards for new products, ensuring high-quality, defect-free designs within project timelines.
• Generate Gerber data and all necessary fabrication files.
• Create PCB footprints from manufacturer datasheets and maintain component library.
• Collaborate with vendors, Mechanical, and Electrical Engineering teams to optimize packaging, thermal, electrical, and manufacturing performance.
• Independently interpret electrical standards (IEC, CSA, UL) and implement them in designs.

• BS in Engineering or related discipline.
• 7+ years of relevant PCB design experience.
• Expert in PCB layout techniques and best practices (EMC, thermal, small signal integrity).
• Highly proficient with the Altium tool suite.
• Experience interpreting electrical schematics to create optimal PCB layouts.
• Experience with 10+ layer PCB designs.
• Familiarity with standards such as UL, CSA, IEC.

job_title: FPGA Design Engineer I - Full Time
job_description:
Date Posted: 2025-12-04

Country: United States of America

Location: AZ852: RMS AP Bldg M East Hermans Road Building M02, Tucson, AZ, 85756 USA

Position Role Type: Onsite

U.S. Citizenship and Security Clearance Requirements: Active and transferable U.S. government issued security clearance required prior to start date. Only U.S. citizens are eligible for security clearance.

Security Clearance: DoD Clearance: Secret

At Raytheon, we are dedicated to helping our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. With more than 100 years of engineering expertise, we strive to meet today's mission challenges. Our team is committed to solving complex problems that foster a safer world.

The FPGA Design Engineer I will develop FPGA designs across various major vendors and device families—including Xilinx, Intel, Microchip, and Lattice. Designs will be implemented using VHDL, addressing applications such as gigabit serial interfaces, Radio Frequency (RF) and Electro-Optical (EO) Digital Signal Processing (DSP), control loops, data links, embedded processing, and processor interfaces. You will collaborate with circuit card designers and systems engineers to gather requirements, select parts, architect the device, perform code development, simulation, and place and route. Your designs will be verified against requirements through both directed testing and constrained random methodologies. Full design support is expected, from requirements definition through integration and testing up to production. Documentation and configuration management of designs will be maintained throughout the entire process.

Qualifications You Must Have:
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related STEM major.
• Experience with digital design and VHDL or Verilog coding.
• Familiarity with Xilinx, Altera, or Microsemi/Microchip FPGAs.
• This position is open to candidates with 12 months or less of relevant professional work experience (excluding internships).

Qualifications We Prefer:
• ABET accreditation preferred, with a desired cumulative GPA of 3.0.
• Familiarity with the Linux environment and commands.
• Expertise in Xilinx, Intel, Microchip, or Lattice devices and tool flows.
• Knowledge of FPGA timing constraints and timing closure.
• Experience in digital signal processing related to FPGA devices.

What We Offer:
• At RTX, our values guide our actions with a commitment to safety, trust, respect, accountability, collaboration, and innovation.
• Relocation eligibility available.

Apply Now!
• Consider the role type definition: Onsite roles require employees to work primarily onsite, as essential for product development.
• Please upload your most recent transcripts along with your resume. Include your cumulative GPA and projected graduation date.
• This role requires a security clearance. DCSA Consolidated Adjudication Services manages the clearance process.

job_description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

Join Adobe as a Senior Staff Engineer and play a critical role in building and evolving the engineering platforms that power Adobe products such as Adobe Express. This role sits at the intersection of software engineering, site reliability engineering, and platform leadership, with a focus on enabling safe, scalable, and efficient software delivery at enterprise scale.

You will work on foundational systems that support multi-tenant, multi-region cloud services used by millions of customers worldwide. As a senior technical leader, you’ll partner closely with product engineering, infrastructure, and security teams to set a higher standard on reliability, automation, and developer productivity while helping shape the future of how Adobe builds and delivers software.

What You’ll Do
• Design, build, and evolve highly reliable software systems and platforms that support large-scale, distributed services.
• Lead the development of GitOps-based workflows and deployment automation.
• Configure and operate services on Kubernetes-based platforms using standardized deployment and configuration patterns.
• Build and maintain infrastructure-as-code using tools such as Terraform to provision and manage cloud resources on AWS.
• Apply AI/ML techniques and tools to enhance the software delivery lifecycle, improve engineering productivity, and streamline operational workflows.
• Apply SRE principles to the design and operation of software systems, emphasizing reliability, scalability, risk management, and operational efficiency.
• Partner with application and platform teams to standardize patterns for service configuration, rollout strategies, and environment management.
• Identify and reduce systemic sources of risk, toil, and inefficiency through thoughtful engineering and automation.
• Contribute technical leadership through design and code reviews and mentoring, helping raise engineering quality across the organization.

What You Need to Succeed
• A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience is required.
• 10+ years of professional software engineering experience, with a strong emphasis on distributed systems and cloud-native architectures.
• Deep experience with GitOps alongside equivalent experience, CI/CD pipelines, and software delivery systems at scale.
• Hands-on and extensive experience working with Kubernetes-based platforms.
• Demonstrated use of AI/ML or intelligent automation to improve engineering productivity, reliability, or operational efficiency.
• Strong expertise with cloud platforms such as AWS and infrastructure-as-code practices.
• Strong programming skills in one or more languages commonly used in platform engineering (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, Go, Python, or similar).
• Demonstrated experience applying Site Reliability Engineering practices to the design, delivery, and operation of large-scale production systems.
• Ability to work effectively across teams, communicate complex technical concepts clearly, and influence engineering direction through technical leadership.
• A continuous improvement outlook, with a passion for building systems that make other engineers more effective.
